H0.text: Consumer to producer is the direction of the movement of energy in a food web.

H1.text: Energy moves from producers to consumers in a food web.

H2.text: Decomposer to producer is the direction of movement of energy in a food web.

H3.text: Decomposer to consumer is the direction of the movement of energy in a food web.

A4.text: Energy flow typically includes production, consumption, assimilation, non-assimilation losses (feces), and respiration (maintenance costs).

A5.text: The biomass of each trophic level decreases from the base of the chain to the top.
